frame.name: FR_Memory-Remembering_experience-Remembering_information
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame is concerned with <fen>Cognizer</fen>s remembering and forgetting <fen>Mental_content</fen>, or a <fen>Salient_entity</fen>. If this <fen>Salient_entity</fen> is remembered in a specific state or performing some action, both the <fen>Salient_entity</fen> and the action/state are included in the <fen>Mental_content</fen>'s span. A <fen>Cognizer</fen> retains facts or experiences in memory and is able to retrieve them. The <fen>Mental_content</fen> may be presented in clearly propositional form as a finite clause. It may also take the form of an embedded question or be a concealed question in the form of a simple NP.
<ex><fex name="cog">Je</fex> me <t>rappelle</t> <fex name="sal">Marie</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="cog">Je</fex> me <t>rappelle</t> <fex name="men"> <fex name="sal">Marie</fex> descendant les escaliers</fex>.</ex>
<ex> I was impressed that <fex name="cog">she</fex> 'd actually <t>remembered</t> <fex name="men">Radish 's name</fex> (= what Radish's name is) </ex>
<ex>Oh, and for those who like to continually whinge about how the French are 'surrender monkeys' - <t>remember</t> <fex name="men">Napoleon</fex> (= who Napoleon was)?</ex>
<ex> <fex name="cog">I</fex> ca n't <t>remember</t> <fex name="men">what DSP stands for</fex>.</ex>
<ex>And <fex name="cog">Bill</fex> can <fex name="tim">still</fex> <t>remember</t> <fex name="men">the pattern</fex> (= what the pattern is). </ex>
<ex><fex name="men">What</fex> do <fex name="cog">you</fex> <t>remember</t> <fex name="top">about your grandma</fex>?</ex>
<ex></ex> Notice that this frame is very general. It can be used to talk about detailed reports of past experience.
<ex>I don't know if I lost consciousness for a while. But I <t>remember</t> <fex name="men">that I was lying in the middle of the road with people trying to assist me</fex>.</ex>
<ex></ex>
<ex></ex> Distinctions with other frames: <ex></ex>
≠ <frframe>Remembering_to_do</frframe>: This frame differs from Remembering_to_do in that this frame is strictly talking about a fact, whereas the Remembering_to_do frame is strictly about tasks which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> would be expected to do. Remembering_to_do uses normally occur with infinitival complements.</def-root> <ex></ex> <asf>Relation to fndata-1.5</asf> : fusion of Memory, Remembering_experience and Remembering_information. All the FEs from Memory and Remembering_information remain the same except that Memory's Experience and Remembering_information's Context are understood to be the same thing and merged into <fen>Context</fen>. <fen>Topic</fen> is here core and in a core set with <fen>Mental_content</fen> as it is in Memory. Remembering_Experience's <fen>Salient_entity</fen> is kept in this merging, and its FEs Experience, State and Impression are all considered to be part of this frame's Mental_content.

FE.name: Cognizer
FE.definition:
<def-root>The person who retains and retrieves information.
<ex>I bet <fex name="cog">Johno</fex> can <t>remember</t> the name of the Ramones' drummer.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Mental_content
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Mental_content</fen> stored by and accessible to the <fen>Cognizer</fen>. It may derive from experience or activity or simply from being informed of it.
<ex>Do you <t>remember</t> <fex name="men">how to spell cupboard ?</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Salient_entity
FE.definition:
<def-root>A person or thing that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> remembers as being involved in some state or event or as having some property.
<ex>today I saw my sister's exclassmate, and didn't recognise him, I <t>remember</t> <fex name="men">him</fex>taller</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Topic
FE.definition:
<def-root>An entity, concrete or abstract, or an event that the remembered <fen>Mental_content</fen> is about.
<ex>The boy who suffered brain damage when he was hit by a vehicle while walking into school testified Friday he <t>remembers</t> nothing <fex name="top">about being hit</fex>. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Context
FE.definition:
<def-root>A situation/event (or period of time standing in for events) or a text from which the <fen>Mental_content</fen> was acquired.
<ex>You will <t>remember</t> <fex name="con">from grade school</fex> that you do not want to make the nuns impatient.</ex></def-root>
